block.p: Kristine Carlin Bay, a television correspondent known as Willow Bay, and Robert Allen Iger, the president and chief operating officer of Capital Cities/ABC, were married yesterday at a house rented for the occasion in Bridgehampton, L.I. Cantor William Walton officiated, with the Rev. Roland Ghirlando, a Roman Catholic priest.

Kristine Carlin Bay, a television correspondent known as Willow Bay, and Robert Allen Iger, the president and chief operating officer of Capital Cities/ABC, were married yesterday at a house rented for the occasion in Bridgehampton, L.I. Cantor William Walton officiated, with the Rev. Roland Ghirlando, a Roman Catholic priest.

Ms. Bay is a host of "N.B.A. Inside Stuff" on NBC. She is also a contributing correspondent to "Good Morning America" on ABC and is a host of the program's Sunday edition. She was the Estee Lauder model from 1983 to 1989.

Ms. Bay graduated cum laude from the University of Pennsylvania and received an M.B.A. degree from New York University. She is a daughter of Deidre L. Bay and Eugene A. Bay of New York. The bride's father, a former publisher of Field and Stream magazine in New York, is a marketing consultant. Her mother is the executive director of the Colonial Dames of America in New York.
Mr. Iger is also a director of Lincoln Center for the Performing Arts in New York. He graduated magna cum laude from Ithaca College. His previous marriage ended in divorce.

Mr. Iger is the son of Mimi and Arthur Iger of Long Beach, L.I. The bridegroom's mother retired as a teaching assistant in the library media center at Boardman Junior High School in Oceanside, L.I. His father, who retired as the executive vice president and general manager of the Greenvale (L.I.) Marketing Corporation, is an adjunct professor of advertising and public relations at the New York Institute of Technology.
